Description of CMU Components:
Unit 5 is a Cogenation unit which produces both steam and power. Unit 5 is the largest generating unit at Fawley refinery. This Generating Unit forms the 'E_FAWN-1' BMU on its own and is part of the larger site inclusive BM Trading Unit, 'EPCO1'. 

All Components of EMG-21 are located within the physical boundaries of the Esso Petroleum Company,Limited, Oil Refinery at Esso Refinery - Fawley - Southampton - Hampshire - SO45 1TX - United Kingdom. 

Unit 5 is one of three power and steam generation units on site and is a Gas Turbine CHP plant. It is connected to the Local Distribution Network (LDN) at 132kV level at the Fawley North Sub-Station (MSID 7081).  Unit 5 is a licensed generator.

Unit 5 has various auxiliary load equipment-  the power for which is supplied from another part of the LDN Fawley North Sub-Station. This auxiliary power has half hourly meters installed. The two auxiliary meters have the IDs: R98HAN757 (aka S36A-VFH-TR01) and R98HAN758 (aka S36A-VFH-TR02). 

Gross 3 HH av. peak generation from Unit 5 on separate days = 137.533 MW
At these three HH times, aux load on Unit 5 = 2.513 MW
Net generation from Unit 5 = 135.020 MW
Location and Post Code: Esso Petroleum Company,Limited, Oil Refinery at Esso Refinery - Fawley - Southampton - Hampshire - SO45 1TX - United Kingdom

Description of CMU Components:
ElecLink will have a transmission capacity of 1000MW corresponding to its grid connection agreements and link the 400kV AC grids of France and Great Britain. ElecLink will employ high voltage direct current converter stations using voltage source converter technology at each side of the Channel Tunnel. 400kV AC underground cables will connect the converter stations to the TSO's high voltage substations: Sellindge (NGET, UK) and Les Mandarins (RTE, France). 

The converter station on the Eurotunnel site at Folkestone will be connected by one 400kV AC cable circuit to the National Grid substation at Sellindge. The route length is approximately 14km.

The converter station on the Eurotunnel site at Coquelles will be connected by one 400kV AC cable circuit to the RTE substation at Les Madarins. The route length is approximately 3.5km.

An approximately 52km long HVDC cable circuit will connect the two converter stations via the Channel Tunnel between Folkestone and Coquelles. This will involve two single-core HVDC cables operating at +-320kV DC.

Please note that in the section below we provided an address for the CMU which relates to the UK converter station site. Of course, given the CMU is an interconnector there are a variety of sites which are owned/managed by ElecLink and relate to the CMU, as additional information we have provided details of those sites below. Please note also that we have provided the grid reference points which most closely correspond to the sites, however the postcode for the address will capture a wider area.

Church Lane
Aldington
Ashford TN25 6SS
Grid reference: TR082383

Therefore, MPANs and BMU IDs do not apply to the ElecLink CMU at this point in time. ElecLink will ensure that the Delivery Body is updated as required once the metering systems are completed.
Location and Post Code: Longport Security Entrance, Terminal Service Road, Folkestone, CT18 8AP

Description of CMU Components:
HVDC interconnector between GB and Danish transmission systems. 

Viking Link will involve the construction of two converter stations, sited in GB and Denmark. At the converter stations, alternating current electricity from the sending end is converted to direct current electricity and transmitted through the cables. The direct current electricity will be converted into alternating current at the receiving end, before it is transmitted to consumers via the onshore electricity networks in GB and Denmark.

In GB, the grid connection point for Viking Link is at Bicker Fen substation. The converter station at North Ing Drove is 2km from the substation which is connected via AC underground cables. From the converter station, the British onshore section covers 68km of HVDC underground cable to the landfall point of Boygrift which marks the beginning of the offshore route. The marine section of the link has a total of 621km from Boygrift to the Danish landing point of Blaabjerg through British, Dutch, German and Danish waters. From the Danish landfall point in Blaabjerg the Danish onshore section of Viking Link covers 76km of HVDC underground cable to the converter station which is adjacent to the Revsing substation.
Location and Post Code: Viking Link, Bicker Fen Converter Station, North Ing Drove, Donnington, Spalding, Lincolnshire, PE11 4XY

The construction at the Sutton Bridge Power CMU (23SB01), an existing Combined Cycle Gas Turbine (CCGT) plant will include both installation of new generating equipment and the upgrade or refurbishment of the current equipment at the site. 1,000MW electricity interconnector between GB and Belgian transmission systems.

The Nemo Link interconnector will consist of subsea and underground cables connected to a converter station in each country, which will allow electricity to flow in either direction between the two countries. Nemo Link® will build the converter station on an 8 hectare site, formerly occupied by the Richborough Power Station, which now forms part of the Richborough Energy Park proposals. A similar converter station will be built in the industry zone Herdersbrug in Bruges.

1,100MW electricity interconnector between GB and French transmission systems.

IFA2 will use a High Voltage Direct Current (HVDC) cable for the connection between Great Britain and France. The electricity must be converted to and from HVDC and the High Voltage Alternating Current (HVAC) used in the domestic electricity transmission systems of Great Britain and France, and this requires a converter station in each country. Cables connect the converter station to a local substation, which transports the electricity onto the domestic network.

Description of CMU Components:
NSL is a subsea high-voltage direct current electricity cable between Norway and the United Kingdom which connects the Transmission Systems of Norway and Great Britain.   

The cable runs from Kvilldal in Norway, to Blyth in the United Kingdom. The converter station in England is located near to the cable landfall in East Sleekburn village and is connected to the National Grid at the Blyth substation.
Location and Post Code: NSL UK Converter Station, East Sleekburn, Bedlington NE22 7FG.

Description of CMU Components:
Viking Link is a HVDC interconnector between GB and Danish transmission systems. 
Viking Link involved the construction of two converter stations, sited in GB and Denmark. At the converter stations, alternating current electricity from the sending end is converted to direct current electricity and transmitted through the cables. The direct current electricity is converted into alternating current at the receiving end, before it is transmitted to consumers via the onshore electricity networks in GB and Denmark.
In GB, the grid connection point for Viking Link is at Bicker Fen substation. The converter station at North Ing Drove is 2km from the substation which is connected via AC underground cables. From the converter station, the British onshore section covers 68km of HVDC underground cable to the landfall point of Boygrift which marks the beginning of the offshore route. The marine section of the link has a total of 621km from Boygrift to the Danish landing point of Blaabjerg through British, Dutch, German and Danish waters. From the Danish landfall point in Blaabjerg the Danish onshore section of Viking Link covers 76km of HVDC underground cable to the converter station which is adjacent to the Revsing substation.
Location and Post Code: Viking Link Ltd, Bicker Fen Converter Station, Northorpe Road, Donington SPALDING PE11 4XY

Description of CMU Components:
Unit 5 is a Cogeneration unit which produces both steam and power. Unit 5 is the largest generating unit at Fawley refinery. This Generating Unit forms the 'E_FAWN-1' BMU on its own and is part of the larger site inclusive BM Trading Unit, 'EPCO1'. 

All Components of EMG244 are located within the physical boundaries of the Esso Petroleum Company,Limited, Oil Refinery at Esso Refinery - Fawley - Southampton - Hampshire - SO45 1TX - United Kingdom. 

Unit 5 is one of three power generation units on the site and is a Gas Turbine CHP plant. It is connected to the Local Distribution Network (LDN) at 132kV level at the Fawley North Sub-Station (MSID 7081).  Unit 5 is a licensed generator.

Unit 5 has various auxiliary load equipment, the power for which is supplied from another part of the LDN Fawley North Sub-Station. This auxiliary power has half hourly meters installed. The two auxiliary meters have the IDs: R98HAN757 (aka S36A-VFH-TR01) and R98HAN758 (aka S36A-VFH-TR02).
Location and Post Code: Esso Petroleum Company,Limited, Oil Refinery at Esso Refinery - Fawley - Southampton - Hampshire - SO45 1TX - United Kingdom

Description of CMU Components:
TG1B is part of the aggregated CMU EMD244, which is made up of 2 Generating Units of which TG1B is the larger. 

This Generating Unit is embedded in the 'E_FAWND' BMU and is part of the larger site inclusive BM Trading Unit, 'EPCO1'. All Components of 'EMD244' are located within the physical boundaries of the Esso Petroleum Company,Limited Oil Refinery at Esso Refinery - Fawley - Southampton - Hampshire - SO45 1TX - United Kingdom. 

TG1B is one of three power generation units on the site and is a Steam Turbine plant. It is connected to the Local Distribution Network (LDN) at 132kV level at the Fawley North Sub-Station (part of MSID 7095). Both Unit 3 and TG1B units share various auxiliary load equipment, the power for which is supplied from another part of the LDN Fawley North Sub-Station. 

Installation of separate metering for the auxiliary power for both TG1B and Unit 3 has been completed providing half hourly meters for the auxiliary load for the two units. Due to the large amount of common equipment shared by the two generation units (TG1B and Unit 3) we are unable to determine exactly what part of the auxiliary load is directly attributable to TG1B and thus for this CMU we have attributed the auxiliary load between the two. The auxiliary meters for Unit 3 and TG1B combined are: TR1MWI_MAIN, TR2MWI_MAIN and 26AMWI_MAIN. This entire metering configuration has been successfully assessed and tested.
Location and Post Code: Esso Refinery - Fawley - Southampton - Hampshire - SO45 1TX - United Kingdom

Description of CMU Components:
Unit 3 is part of the aggregated CMU EMD244, which is made up of 2 Generating Units of which Unit 3 is the smallest. 

This Generating Unit is embedded in the ?E_FAWND? BMU and is part of the larger site inclusive BM Trading Unit, ?EPCO1?. All Components of ?EMD244? are located within the physical boundaries of the Esso Petroleum Company,Limited Oil Refinery at Esso Refinery - Fawley - Southampton - Hampshire - SO45 1TX - United Kingdom. 

Unit 3 is one of three power generation units on site and is a Gas Turbine CHP plant. It is connected to the Local Distribution Network (LDN) at 132kV level at their Fawley North Sub-Station (part of MSID 7095). Both units share various auxiliary load equipment, the power for which is supplied from another part of the LDN Fawley North Sub-Station. 

Installation of separate metering for the auxiliary power for both TG1B and Unit 3 has been completed providing half hourly meters for the auxiliary load for the two units. Due to the large amount of common equipment shared by the two generation units (TG1B and Unit 3) we are unable to determine exactly what part of the auxiliary load is directly attributable to Unit 3 and thus for this CMU we have attributed the auxiliary load between the two. The auxiliary meters for Unit 3 and TG1B combined are: TR1MWI_MAIN, TR2MWI_MAIN and 26AMWI_MAIN. This entire metering configuration has been successfully assessed and tested.
Location and Post Code: Esso Refinery - Fawley - Southampton - Hampshire - SO45 1TX - United Kingdom

The Nemo Link interconnector is a joint venture between National Grid Interconnector Holdings Limited, a subsidiary company of the UK?s National Grid Plc, and the Belgian Elia group.  
The interconnector electrically connects Belgium and GB providing both countries with improved grid reliability and access to sustainable generation.  
Nemo Link consists of subsea and underground cables connected to a converter station and an electricity substation in each country, which allows electricity to flow in either direction between the two countries. The interconnector commenced commercial operations on 31st January 2019.

ElecLink has a transmission capacity of 1000MW corresponding to its grid connection agreements and link the 400kV AC grids of France and Great Britain. ElecLink employs voltage direct current converter stations using voltage source converter technology at each side of the Channel Tunnel. 400kV AC underground cables connect the converter stations to the TSO's high voltage substations: Sellindge (NGET, UK) and Les Mandarins (RTE, France). 

The converter station on the Eurotunnel site at Folkestone is connected by one 400kV AC cable circuit to the National Grid substation at Sellindge. The route length is approximately 14km.

The converter station on the Eurotunnel site at Coquelles is connected by one 400kV AC cable circuit to the RTE substation at Les Madarins. The route length is approximately 3.5km.

An approximately 52km long HVDC cable circuit connects the two converter stations via the Channel Tunnel between Folkestone and Coquelles. This involves two single-core HVDC cables operating at +-320kV DC.

Please note that in the section below we provided an address for the CMU which relates to the UK substation site at Sellindge, given this the location of the ElecLink interconnector in our bilateral connection agreement with National Grid ESO. Of course, given the CMU is an interconnector there are a variety of sites which are owned/managed by ElecLink and relate to the CMU, as additional information we have provided details of those sites below. Please note also that we have provided the grid reference points which most closely correspond to the sites, however the postcode for the address will capture a wider area.

Description of CMU Components: The component is a 5.4 MWp solar PV site with a 10.527 MVA export connection. This export connection is shared with an adjacent 5 MWp solar PV site which claims the FIT subsidy. This adjacent 5 MWp solar PV site is intended to be a non-CMU site. The two solar farms, while sharing a grid connection have separate MPANs and therefore separately metered. While the connection is oversized for the CMU, as it is shared, the limiting factor is the MWp of the CMU as the export connection is greater than the sum of the two sites' MWp. Hence the connection capacity submitted is 5.400 MWp.
Location and Post Code:
Bosworth Solar Farm, Hall Farm, Newbold 
Verdon, Leicestershire LE9 9NL

Description of CMU Components: CMU component is a 8.444 MWp solar PV site and shares its 10.900 MW export and import MPAN connection with a second PV asset, which has a capacity of 4.997 MWp. This smaller PV site is non-CMU as it it ineligible since it claims the RO subsidy. As the connection is oversized compared to the CMU, the limiting factor to the CMU capacity is the MWp of the generating assets which share the connection. For the applicant CMU, there is 5.903 MW available. This is the difference between the available connection capacity and the MWp capacity of the RO generating asset.
Location and Post Code: High Garrett, Sisted, Braintree, Essex, CM77 8BX
